issue.title: [Rust] [Datafusion] Optionally load tpch data into memory before running benchmark query
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10240](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10240). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The tpch benchmark runtime seems to be dominated by csv parsing code and it is really difficult to see any performance hotspots related to actual query execution in a flamegraph.

With the date in memory and more iterations it should be easier to profile and find bottlenecks.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10240?focusedCommentId=17210516) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
Great idea `[~jhorstmann]` . Do you want me to take care of this or are you planning on working on it? I could do this tonight.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10240?focusedCommentId=17210531) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
On second thoughts, I might not be able to get to this right away.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10240?focusedCommentId=17210700) by Jörn Horstmann (jhorstmann):*
Hi `[~andygrove]`, I was already working on this and should have assigned the ticket to me directly.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10240?focusedCommentId=17211779) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
Issue resolved by pull request 8409
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8409>
